page.title: 06FARMING STOCKLAND/COTLEIGH.
page.content: Mostly dairy farming and beef.One farmer breeds Arab strain horses and has a flock of Jacob sheep.Winter sheep population is greater as farmers in the Midlands send flocks for winter grazing.Most are cross bred.Cattle feed crops and some corn are grown. Farms are very mechanized,usually run by one man with his sons.The last horse powered farming died out in the sixties.There are two annual grass crops,mostly silage with some hay. Milking cows are Friesan but Hereford bulls are favoured being gentler.Very little hand milking.Straw for bedding comes largely from the Midlands.Rare breeds are bred on a small scale.A goat farm sells the milk and cheese.There are some pigs,some are Landrace cross.Most farmers keep free range hens.Some cider is made.Ducks geese and turkeys kept seasonally.
